intro: Lippia nutans, commonly known as the nodding lippia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, often arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Lippia nutans is known for its aromatic leaves, which contain essential oils used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
